intro: Elleanthus attenuatus, commonly known as the slender elleanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its slender stems and small, yellowish flowers make it a distinctive yet understated member of the flora. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
